section.title: Adding a USB Policy

formalpara.title: Summary
formalpara.para: Add a USB policy to the USB Filter Editor.

section.para: Double-click the USB Filter Editor shortcut icon on your desktop to open the editor.

step.para: Click the Add button. The Edit USB Criteria window opens:
Use the USB Class, Vendor ID, Product ID, and Revision check boxes and lists to specify the device.
Click the Allow button to permit virtual machines use of the USB device; click the Block button to prohibit the USB device from virtual machines.
Click OK to add the selected filter rule to the list and close the window.

example.title: Adding a Device
example.para: The following is an example of how to add USB Class Smartcard, device EP-1427X-2 Ethernet Adapter, from manufacturer Acer Communications & Multimedia to the list of allowed devices.

step.para: Click FileSave to save the changes.

formalpara.title: Result
formalpara.para: You have added a USB policy to the USB Filter Editor. USB filter policies need to be exported to the Red Hat Virtualization Manager to take effect.
